fields.description:
The exact event messages for the events from the Isilon REST API are still being confirmed with Isilon team. The correctness of the messages and the correlation with the event type id is important as the Alert mapping in ESA relies on both. 

Once the event messages are finalized, the ESA code will need to be modified to reflect that.
fields.summary: Isilon : Alert message refactoring

issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
step:
1. Add VPLEX Metro instance in pure IPv6 env
2. Click "Test Connection"
Actual result:
1. Return error message" Unable to establish a valid connection to the target system. Verify 10.110.24.121 is reachable and is a valid host name or IP address".
Expected result:
1. Test successfully
Discuss with yiming, probably the root cause is that when I add a cluster Ipv6 to vrops, it can send a CLI command to retrieve another cluster ip and but return ip is a ipv4. As it is pure ipv6 env, the exception is happended.
fields.summary: VPLEX Metro: Cannot add instance in pure IPv6 env
fields.environment:
vROps:
 https://[2620:0:170:7e0f::98] ;admin/Password123!
ESA: 3.5.0.167435
VPLEX metro:
Cluster 1:https://10.110.24.121
Cluster 2:https://10.110.24.122
service/Mi@Dim7T*

fields.description:
After upgrading ESA 3.3 to 3.4, the alert definitions are messy. 
Please see the before.png, there is a "Capacity used in the volume is high.", which is defined for XtremIO, after upgrading (after.png), the alert is gone, instead it is replaced by "Ethernet port is having problem". What the worse is the latter alert actually belongs to another adapter instance - VPLEX.
fields.summary: Alert definitions go messy after upgrading PAK

fields.description:
step:
1. Add XtremIO instance to vROps.
2. Wait several collection cycles.
3. Go to Inventory Explorer - Adapter Instances - EMC Adapter Instance
4. Check the numbers of volumes and snapshots
5. Compare the numbers of volumes and snapshots with GUI.
Actual results:
1. The numbers of volumes and snapshots in vROps are not consistent with GUI.
Expected results:
1. The numbers of volumes and snapshots in vROps are consistent with GUI.
fields.summary: XtremIO: The numbers of volumes in vROps are not consistent with GUI
fields.environment:
XtremIO: 10.110.44.242
Array ID: CKM00131304589
ESA: ESA 3.4 release version
vROps:6.1

fields.customfield_10309:
The reason for the incorrect names might be it references VNXe UEMCLI, which shows different properties from REST API.
Correct field definitions are in REST API doc. (because ESA uses REST API)

This fix renames the key and display name of the 2 metrics, and update references in capacity model and views.
fields.customfield_10301:
1. Install the ESA patch, add VNXe adapter instance
2. See Capacity metrics of a File System
Verify:
 * There are no metric names: "Capacity (GB)", "Max Capacity (GB)"
 * There are metric names: "Allocated Capacity (GB)", "Total Capacity (GB)". And their values are the same compared with Unisphere.
3. Verify the changed metric names and values are correct in "VNXe File System Capacity Trend", and "VNXe File System List" views.
fields.description:
These metrics have incorrect name which is very confusing:
"Max Capacity (GB)" should be changed to "Total Capacity (GB)"
"Capacity (GB)" should be changed to "Allocated Capacity (GB)"

User guide also need update with this fix. (See attached image)
fields.summary: VNXe: Incorrect metric names "Max Capacity (GB)", "Capacity (GB)" on File System

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and has been verified.

fields.customfield_10309: Supplement the calculated metrics in CalculatedMetric.
fields.description:
During the XtremIO automated test execution for ESA 3.4, 2 issues were encountered and we had to switch to manual testing:
1. Data points in the metric files dumped from vR Ops server via REST API seem to be duplicated. We saw many different metrics with same metric values (a string of consecutive data points). The values are very precise (multiple digits after the decimal point), so it's not likely that the duplicated values are real metric data.
2. When the automation test compares two values, the test fails because the values are not identical (discrepancy not within the tolerance range). However, when we debugged in Eclipse, the test succesfully passed.
fields.summary: ESA Automation : Duplicate data points and incorrect metric comparison for XtremIO

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: QA - VNX Block: actually not completed in Unisphere when migrate displays completed in vrops

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A development sub-task.
issuetype.name: Development Sub-task

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.customfield_10309:
Root cause:
The completion of command "migrate -start" was thought as the completion of migration session.
But it actually means the migration is successfully started. And migration state can only be queried by "migrate -list" command.

Fix:
* Because LUN migration may take more than 8 hours (vR Ops action timeout), we keep current behavior to let action complete once the command is successful. But change the result message to "LUN migration is started successfully."

* Add LUN migration state alerts based on a new property "Migration State" (retrieved by "migrate -list" command):

| Level	 	| Alert														| Symptom													   |
| --------- | --------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Info		| This LUN is migrating										| "Migration State" = QUEUED/TRANSITIONING/MIGRATING/MIGRATED  | 
| Critical	| Migration of this LUN is faulted							| "Migration State" = FAULTED								   |
| Warning	| Migration of this LUN is stopped due to destination full.	| "Migration State" = STOPPED - Destination full			   |

* Remove these events to avoid duplication of the new alerts:
LUN migration queued.
Migration started.
Migration halted.
Migration completed.
fields.customfield_10301:
1. Install the ESA patch, add VNX Block adapter instance.
2. Execute "Migrate" action on a VNX LUN.
Verify:
* After action complete, action result message is "LUN migration is started successfully."
* When migration is in progress, there is a health info alert "This LUN is migrating" on the LUN
* After migration is completed (command "migrate -list" returns no migration session), the alert is canceled.
* No Migration event alert occured.
fields.description:
Step:
1. Login vR Ops.
2. Perform "migrate" action from raid group 1 to raid group 2.
3. Go to recently task page.
4. The task status is changed to completed so quickly.
5. Check update in Unisphere.

Actual result:
1. The task status is completed in vrops.
2. Migrate successfully after several minutes in Uniphere.
Expected result:
1. when task status is completed in vrops, update results on time in Unisphere. So task status should return by real result from uniphere.
fields.summary: VNX Block: actually not completed in Unisphere when migrate displays completed in vrops

fields.customfield_10309: Correctly set the dump status for the vplex cli connection to the paired cluster.
fields.customfield_10301:
1. Use vR Ops to monitor VPLEX Metro system, the adapter instance's ip address is for cluster-1.
2.Switch vR Ops to "write dump" mode.
3. Observe the metrics for directors on cluster-2 on the GUI, they look all ok.
4. Observe the dump files, there are dump files corresponding to the vplex monitoring files for directors from cluster-2, the content should be valid instead of "-1".
5. Switch vR Ops to "read dump" mode.
6. Observe the metrics for directors on cluster-2 on the GUI (after vR Ops starts to read dump files), all metrics should keep being generated.
fields.description:
1. Use vR Ops to monitor VPLEX Metro system, the adapter instance's ip address is for cluster-1.
2.Switch vR Ops to "write dump" mode.
3. Observe the metrics for directors on cluster-2 on the GUI, they look all ok.
4. Observe the dump files, there are dump files corresponding to the vplex monitoring files for directors from cluster-2, but the content is "-1".
5. Switch vR Ops to "read dump" mode.
6. Observe the metrics for directors on cluster-2 on the GUI (after vR Ops starts to read dump files), there are no data points.

Expected result:
1. After switching to "write dump" mode, the dump files corresponding to the monitoring files for the directors on cluster-2 should have meaningful values other than "-1".
2. After switching to "read dump" mode, the metrics for directors on cluster-2 should keep being generated.

The root cause is : ESA will ssh to cluster-1 (the one whose ip address was used during the adapter instance creation) to look for monitoring files to get director metrics from. Since in a VPLEX Metro system, a cluster only generates monitoring files for its own directors, ESA won't find monitoring files for directors on cluster-2, then it will ssh to cluster-2 to look for them. That's how ESA is able to get metrics for all directors from both clusters (see code [here|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/VCOPS/repos/vcopsadapter/browse/collectors/vplex/src/main/java/com/emc/vcops/collectors/vplex/VplexCollectService.java#299]). However, in the process, for the dumping logic, it goes like:
1. When ESA tries to find cluster-2 directors' monitoring files on cluster-1, it fails to find them, as a result, it generates dump files for the directors with content "-1". See [here|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/PIE/repos/vplex-adapter-java/browse/cli/src/main/java/com/emc/pie/adapters/vplex/cli/VplexCliAdapterImpl.java#35].
2. When ESA switches to cluster-2 to find the monitoring files for cluster-2 directors, [VplexCliAdapterImpl#setDumpFolder|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/PIE/repos/vplex-adapter-java/browse/cli/src/main/java/com/emc/pie/adapters/vplex/cli/VplexCliAdapterImpl.java#638] and [VplexCliAdapterImpl#setDumpFolderToRead|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/PIE/repos/vplex-adapter-java/browse/cli/src/main/java/com/emc/pie/adapters/vplex/cli/VplexCliAdapterImpl.java#644] are not properly set in [VplexCollector#setOutputDumpStatus|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/VCOPS/repos/vcopsadapter/browse/collectors/vplex/src/main/java/com/emc/vcops/collectors/vplex/VplexCollector.java#355] for the new VplexCliAdapterImpl instance for cluster-2.

To fix this, correctly invoke [VplexCliAdapterImpl#setDumpFolder|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/PIE/repos/vplex-adapter-java/browse/cli/src/main/java/com/emc/pie/adapters/vplex/cli/VplexCliAdapterImpl.java#638] and [VplexCliAdapterImpl#setDumpFolderToRead|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/PIE/repos/vplex-adapter-java/browse/cli/src/main/java/com/emc/pie/adapters/vplex/cli/VplexCliAdapterImpl.java#644] for the paired cluster.

fields.customfield_10309:
This is an enhancement to VNX, eNAS and VNXe expand actions.
Now these actions will check available pool size before issue the expand command.
Available pool size is retrieved from a metric, and passed as a hidden parameter in actions:
```<ActionContextField hidden="true" key="storage_pool_name" namekey="5080006" parameter="storage_pool_name" value="children('EMC', 'StoragePool')[0].resourceName"/>```
```<ActionContextField hidden="true" key="available_pool_size_gb" namekey="5080012" parameter="available_pool_size_gb" value="children('EMC', 'StoragePool')[0].attribute('capacity|vnxblock_available_capacity_gb')"/>```
So action will fail immediately if pool size is not enough for expansion.

This can shorten the action execution time, and avoid potential command output parsing error.

Updated actions:
    Expand VNX Block Pool LUN
    Expand VNXe LUN
    Extend VNX/eNAS/VNXe File System
fields.customfield_10301:
1. Install the ESA patch, add VNX Block and File, VNXe and eNAS adapter instances
2. Execute these actions with size to increase > available pool size
    Expand VNX Block Pool LUN
    Expand VNXe LUN
    Extend VNX/eNAS/VNXe File System
Verify the actions fail with correct error message
fields.description:
step:
1. Login vrops.
2. Add eNAS instance.
3. Wait to collect data.
4. Extend a filesystem set up from storage pool which is used up.
5. Check the status of action task.

Actual result:
1. The task display completed.
Expected result:
1. The task should display failed and error message shows "insufficient storage pool space,couldn't extand file system".
fields.summary: eNAS: extend file system shouldn't display completed when storage pool is used up
fields.environment:
vROps: https://10.102.7.56; admin/Password123!
ESA: 3.4.0.167369
eNAS: https://10.110.42.81 ; nasadmin/nasadmin

fields.customfield_10309: Increase the retryCount in which method define it
fields.customfield_10301: Verify if XtremIO adapter collect resources normally.
fields.description:
While collecting resources of XtremIO 3.x use multi-thread, we found XtremIOAdpater wouldn't try connecting more than 1 time in case of getting 500 response status. so the adapter would keep sending this rest call unit get normal response regardless the maximum retry count.

The root cause is we define the retryCount as a basic int type, and expect to increase the retryCount by passing it into another method.
fields.summary: XtremIO: Multi-thread call doesn't try more than 1 time in case of getting 500 error

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
For ipv6 testing, entering the ipv6 address plus a port number during an adapter instance creation? 

 Based on [PlatformAdapterInfoFactory#instance|https://pie6.rtp.lab.emc.com/projects/VCOPS/repos/vcopsadapter/browse/commons/src/main/java/com/emc/vcops/commons/factories/PlatformAdapterInfoFactory.java?at=release%2FVCOPS-3194-3.4#108], the url parsing would go awry if the user inputs ipv6 address with a port number (e.g. 2001:cdba:0000:0000:0000:0000:3257:9652:8080). VNX Block wraps ipv6 address with []?so it will bypass the entire parsing logic and probably wont have any issue even when a port number is entered. But Im not sure about VMAX, maybe VMAX has some specific code that could bypass the code as well. The other platforms could also encounter the same issue. 

Also according to the code, if the input is like https://2001:cdba:0000:0000:0000:0000:3257:9652:8080, the flawed code will be by-passed.

If the input is like 2001:cdba:0000:0000:0000:0000:3257:9652:8080 (without the protocol prefix), it could hit the issue.
fields.summary: ipv6 support for all adapters

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and has been verified.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_10309: Add/revise metrics, reconfigure Isilon Overview dashboard.
fields.customfield_10301:
1. According to the JIRA card description and the engineering spec, verify the revised metrics and new metrics, make sure they behave correctly.
2.. According to the JIRA card description and the engineering spec, verify the Isilon Overview dashboard, make sure the revised widgets are configured with the correct metric, and the threshold settings are in line with design.
fields.description:
1. Modify metric Node | Cache | Overall Cache Throughput Rate (Bytes/s)
Currently the formula used is:
{color:#d04437} node.ifs.cache.l1.data.read.start + 
 node.ifs.cache.l2.data.read.start + 
 node.ifs.cache.l3.data.read.start + 
 node.ifs.cache.l1.data.read.hit + 
 node.ifs.cache.l2.data.read.hit + 
 node.ifs.cache.l3.data.read.hit{color}

However actually, "hit" is a subset of "start" thus only the latter should be taken into account. Revise the formula to 
{color:#d04437} node.ifs.cache.l1.data.read.start + 
 node.ifs.cache.l2.data.read.start + 
 node.ifs.cache.l3.data.read.start{color}

2. Correct metric Node | Performance | Average Disk Operations Size (MB)
There is a code flaw causing the calculation not taking node.disk.xfers.in.rate.avg  into account, fix the code flaw.

3. Add new metric Cluster | Capacity | Remaining Capacity (%), refer to the latest engineering spec for details.

4. Color thresholds for Disk Operations Latency in Isilon Overview dashboard:
Add color threshold settings as below:
*    [0, 20) - green
*    [20, +? - red

5. Estimated Usable Capacity
   1) Rename Estimated Usable Capacity in Isilon Overview dashboard to Remaining Capacity (%).
   2) Use new metric Cluster | Capacity | Remaining Capacity (%) for this scoreboard widget instead of Cluster | Capacity | Remaining Capacity (TB)
   3) Add color thresholds for Remaining Capacity in Isilon Overview dashboard:
*          [0,10] - red
*          (10,100] - green

6. Remove color thresholds for Overall Cache Hit Rate in Isilon Overview Dashboard
fields.summary: Isilon : Incorrect dashboard thresholds and metrics

status.description: This issue is being reviewed in order to provide more information about it.
status.name: In Review

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
ESA seem to be unable to complete a collection on large configurations.

----

Hi Josh,
 
VPLEX management servers responded to all ESA requests.  Please see the sampling I paired up in [^esa-vplex.xlsx].  Other sheets contain the original,  individual requests and responses.
 
Thanks,
Minh


Hi Josh,
 
From the emcadapter log for Mercury, I was able to extract the requests from the current collections.  I did the same with our VPLEXs vplex-ms-stats log.  The snapshots at the time was captured [^ESA-Mercury-Requests-Responses.xlsx]. Note that our ms-stats log has more data, so please scroll to the bottom of the sheet.
 
For ESA, I could only extract records of  roughly 10 minutes span. I might have missed something. The logs continue to roll.  Would you please check?
 
Thanks,
Minh
